summary: Remdesivir was the first drug approved by the Food and Drug Administration to treat COVID-19 . Gilead Sciences, Inc., originally developed it to treat other viral diseases. We reviewed federal contributions to development of remdesivir and related agency patent rights. As of Dec. 2020, federal funding for preclinical studies and clinical trials involving remdesivir totaled about $162 million. The federal contributions did not result in...
title: Biomedical Research: Information on Federal Contributions to Remdesivir
